Articles.Content:
It was a normal flight test. Then it said I can't accelerate time warp because my ship was accelerating. Then I saw this:

I do not know how rare this is but it looks amazing! The most amazing part is that the light does weaken! As seen here:
Not really that rare as the Mun orbits at 0 degrees inclination, but always cool to see!

Very nice!

This was my first full eclipse. I saw it doing a launch pad test in IVA view:

I don't think the lighting actually weakens.

And we get soooo many threads about eclipses... they should add some inclination to Mun so we stop getting so many of these threads

I don't think the lighting actually weakens.

And we get soooo many threads about eclipses... they should add some inclination to Mun so we stop getting so many of these threads

Yes, move Minmus to a dunar orbit and give Mun an inclination.
What do Minmus and Duna have to do with this?

I don't think the lighting actually weakens.

And we get soooo many threads about eclipses... they should add some inclination to Mun so we stop getting so many of these threads

I agree. Eclipse on every month is more boring and annoying than interesting.

There could also be tourist contracts for plane flight which follows the eclipse in atmosphere above 10 km (or something).
Oh, I like the eclipse monthly and never get tired of seeing it. If I could have a wish to be added to KSP, I would love to see comets added to the game...
Things came over all "2001" when I experienced a Kerbolar eclipse while investigating a Mun arch. Kerson Kerman reported that the arch was 'full of stars' whatever that means

Oh, I like the eclipse monthly and never get tired of seeing it. If I could have a wish to be added to KSP, I would love to see comets added to the game...

Seconded. And nicer flares, corona effect, an actual shadow covering the ship and planet below...
Apparently I took this sceenie on my 3rd day of playing the game, back in '13.
